name: abnormal gas collection in pelvis
description: Presence of gas or air pockets in the pelvic region, can indicate pathology.

name: abnormality of entire testis
description: Any generalized pathological condition affecting the whole testis.

name: adnexal lesion with high diastolic flow
description: Abnormal adnexal structure showing increased diastolic blood flow on Doppler ultrasound, possibly indicating neoplasm.
synonyms: Ovarian lesion with high diastolic flow

name: adrenal calcification
description: Calcified deposits within the adrenal glands, indicating past hemorrhage or infection.

name: adrenal enlargement
description: Increase in size of the adrenal glands, may indicate hyperplasia or tumor.

name: adrenal insufficiency
description: Underproduction of adrenal hormones, leading to symptoms such as fatigue and hypotension.

name: adrenal pseudotumor
description: Mimics appearance of a tumor but is not a true neoplasm, often consists of adrenal tissue.

name: adrenal tumor
description: Neoplastic growth within the adrenal gland, could be benign or malignant.

name: ambiguous genitalia
description: External genitalia that does not have typical male or female characteristics, often due to development disorders.

name: anechoic prostate lesion
description: Fluid-filled lesion in the prostate, appears dark on ultrasound.

name: anechoic renal mass
description: Fluid-filled renal lesion appearing dark (anechoic) on ultrasound, suggesting cystic nature.

name: anorchia
description: Congenital absence of one or both testes.

name: anterior urethral stricture
description: Narrowing of the anterior segment of the urethra, hindering urine flow.

name: avascular renal mass
description: Renal mass without blood supply, often indicating necrosis or cystic nature.

name: bifid scrotum
description: A scrotum divided into two distinct parts, often associated with DSD.

name: bilateral adrenal enlargement
description: Enlarged adrenal glands on both sides, can indicate hyperplasia or neoplasm.

name: bilateral large kidneys
description: Both kidneys are enlarged, may be due to polycystic kidney disease or other anomalies.

name: bilateral or multiple cystic renal masses
description: Presence of multiple fluid-filled cysts in both kidneys.

name: bilateral small kidneys
description: Reduction in size of both kidneys, suggesting chronic kidney disease or congenital anomalies.

name: bilateral testicular masses
description: Presence of masses in both testes, could be due to infection, tumor or cysts.

name: bilaterally decreased renal contrast concentration
description: Reduced concentration of contrast medium in both kidneys indicating potential dysfunction.

name: bladder calculus
description: Stone formation within the bladder usually visible on imaging.

name: bladder diverticulum
description: Outpouching of the bladder wall leading to potential complications.

name: bladder dysfunction
description: Impaired bladder function that can cause urinary symptoms.

name: bladder filling defect
description: An area within the bladder that does not fill with contrast, may indicate a mass or other lesion.

name: bladder tumor
description: A neoplastic growth within the bladder, can be benign or malignant.

name: bladder wall calcification
description: Calcium deposits in the bladder wall, potentially indicative of underlying pathology.

name: calcification in bladder wall or lumen
description: Presence of calcium deposits within the bladder wall or lumen.

name: calcifications in female genital tract
description: Calcium deposits within the female reproductive organs.

name: calcifications in scrotum
description: Calcium deposits within the scrotum or its contents.

name: cervical mass
description: An abnormal growth in the cervical region that requires further evaluation.

name: clitoromegaly
description: Enlargement of the clitoris that may be congenital or acquired.

name: clubbing or destruction of renal calyces
description: Changes to the renal calyces structure, often from chronic obstruction or infection.

name: complex cystic adnexal mass
description: A mass in the adnexal region with both cystic and solid components.

name: complex pelvic mass
description: An abnormal mass in the pelvic area with mixed components.

name: congenital renal cystic disease
description: A group of disorders characterized by cyst formation in the kidneys present from birth.

name: congenital renal or ureteral anomaly
description: Developmental abnormalities of the kidney or ureter.

name: cortical nephrocalcinosis
description: Calcium depositions within the renal cortex visible on imaging.

name: cryptorchidism
description: Undescended testes not present in the scrotum at infancy or childhood.

name: cystic adnexal mass
description: Fluid-filled mass in the adnexal region often diagnosed on ultrasound.

name: cystic adrenal lesion
description: A fluid-filled lesion located in the adrenal gland.

name: cystic extratesticular mass in scrotum
description: A fluid-filled mass located outside the testicle in the scrotum.

name: cystic fetal mid-abdominal mass
description: A fluid-filled mass within the mid-abdomen of a fetus.

name: cystic fetal pelvic mass
description: A fluid-filled mass in the pelvis of a fetus.

name: cystic pelvic mass
description: A fluid-filled mass located in the pelvic region.

name: cystic renal mass
description: A fluid-filled mass in the kidney.

name: cystic renal mass with internal debris
description: A fluid-filled mass in the kidney containing internal particulate matter.

name: cystic renal mass with wall calcification
description: A fluid-filled mass in the kidney with calcified walls.

name: cystic retroperitoneal mass
description: A fluid-filled mass located in the retroperitoneal space.

name: cystic structure near seminal vesicle
description: A fluid-filled structure located near the seminal vesicle.

name: cystic testicular mass
description: A fluid-filled mass within the testicle.

name: cystitis
description: Inflammation of the urinary bladder.

name: dark kidney on T2 MRI
description: A kidney with low signal intensity on T2-weighted MRI.
synonyms: dark renal signal on T2 MRI

name: decreased nephrogram
description: Reduced contrast enhancement of the kidney on imaging.

name: decreased renal artery diastolic flow
description: Reduced blood flow in the renal artery during diastole.
synonyms: low diastolic flow in renal artery

name: decreased renal cortical echogenicity
description: Lower than normal echogenicity of the renal cortex on ultrasound.

name: decreased renal transplant function
description: Reduction in the functional capacity of a transplanted kidney.

name: decreased size of part of a kidney
description: Reduction in the size of a segment of the kidney.

name: dense nephrogram
description: Increased contrast enhancement of the kidney on imaging.

name: depression in renal margin
description: Indentation observed on the kidney's surface.

name: diffusely enlarged uterus
description: Uniformly increased size of the uterus, possibly indicating a pathological process.

name: dilatation of ureter
description: Widening of the ureter, possibly due to obstruction or reflux.

name: dilated posterior urethra
description: Enlarged segment of the posterior urethra, potentially indicating an obstruction or anatomical anomaly.

name: diminished size of renal transplant
description: Renal transplant that appears smaller than expected, may suggest atrophy or rejection.

name: displacement of pelvic ureter
description: Ureter in an abnormal position within the pelvis, possibly due to mass effect or surgical changes.

name: early renal vein opacification
description: Premature filling of the renal vein on imaging, may suggest abnormal flow or shunting.

name: endometrial fluid
description: Presence of fluid within the endometrial cavity.

name: endometrial thickening
description: Increased thickness of the endometrial lining, may indicate hyperplasia or neoplasia.

name: enlarged prostate
description: Increased size of the prostate gland, often due to benign prostatic hyperplasia.

name: enlarged scrotum
description: Scrotum larger than normal, possibly containing fluid, hernia, or mass.

name: enlargement of renal transplant
description: Renal transplant appears larger than expected, can suggest acute rejection or other pathology.

name: epididymal lesion
description: An abnormal mass or area of tissue within or near the epididymis.

name: extratesticular tumor in scrotum
description: A tumor located outside the testes but within the scrotal sac.

name: extrinsic pressure deformity of bladder
description: Deformation of the bladder shape due to external pressure, often from a mass.

name: fallopian tube calcification
description: Finding of calcified deposits within or on the fallopian tubes.

name: fallopian tube mass
description: A lesion or growth arising within or on the fallopian tube.

name: fat-containing renal mass
description: Renal mass that contains fat, suggestive of angiomyolipoma or other fat-containing tumors.

name: filling defect in renal collecting system
description: Area within the renal collecting system where contrast or signal is lacking, possibly indicating a mass or clot.

name: fluid collection in scrotum
description: Accumulation of fluid within the scrotal sac, could be hydrocele or other fluid collections.

name: focal bladder wall thickening
description: Localized area of increased thickness of the bladder wall, possible indicator of tumor or inflammation.

name: focal calcification in kidney
description: Localized region of calcification within the kidney

name: focal defect in nephrogram
description: Localized area of decreased contrast uptake in the kidney

name: focal renal parenchymal scar
description: Localized scarring within the renal parenchyma, often post-infection or post-surgery

name: free fluid in cul-de-sac
description: Presence of fluid in the rectouterine pouch

name: gas in bladder wall or lumen
description: Presence of gas within the bladder wall or lumen, can indicate infection or fistula

name: gastroschisis
description: Congenital defect where intestines are outside the body through a hole near the belly button

name: generalized bladder wall thickening
description: Diffuse thickening of the bladder wall

name: genital anomaly
description: Congenital abnormality of the genital organs

name: germ cell testicular tumor
description: Tumor arising from germ cells in the testicle, may be malignant

name: high-density renal cyst
description: Renal cyst with higher than expected attenuation or intensity, possibly due to hemorrhage or debris

name: hypercalciuria
description: Excess calcium in the urine, often detected via lab tests

name: hyperechoic focal uterine lesion
description: An area within the uterus that appears brighter on ultrasound

name: hyperechoic prostate lesion
description: Bright appearing lesion within the prostate on ultrasound

name: hyperechoic renal cortex
description: Renal cortex that appears brighter than usual on ultrasound

name: hyperechoic renal mass
description: Renal mass appearing brighter on ultrasound, typically benign like angiomyolipoma

name: hyperechoic renal medulla
description: Renal medulla that appears brighter on ultrasound

name: hyperechoic renal parenchyma
description: Renal parenchyma appears brighter on ultrasound, could indicate medical renal disease

name: hypervascular prostate lesion
description: Prostate lesion with increased blood flow, often concerning for malignancy

name: hypoechoic prostate lesion
description: Prostate lesion appearing darker on ultrasound, may indicate cancer

name: hypoechoic renal mass
description: Renal mass appearing darker on ultrasound

name: hypogonadism
description: Condition where the body produces insufficient sex hormones

name: hypoplastic labia majora
description: Underdeveloped labia majora

name: hypospadias
description: Urethral opening located on the underside of the penis

name: hypospadias or ambiguous external genitalia
description: Hypospadias with uncertain genital sexual characteristics

name: increased renal artery diastolic flow
description: Elevated diastolic flow in the renal artery

name: increased resistance index of renal transplant
description: Higher resistance in a transplanted kidney's arteries

name: indefinite uterus sign
description: Imprecisely defined uterine shape on imaging

name: infundibular narrowing
description: Constriction of the infundibulum, particularly in the gallbladder or heart

name: intraluminal ureteral filling defect
description: Filling defect within the ureter lumen

name: intrarenal contrast collection
description: Contrast material collected within the kidney

name: isoechoic prostate lesion
description: Prostate lesion with same echogenicity as surrounding tissue

name: isoechoic renal mass
description: Renal mass with echogenicity similar to renal parenchyma

name: large bladder
description: Enlargement of the urinary bladder

name: large kidney
description: Kidney that is larger than normal size

name: large kidneys with multifocal masses
description: Enlarged kidneys containing several masses

name: large pelvic soft-tissue mass
description: Significant mass within pelvic soft tissue

name: large penis
description: Penis larger than typical size range for age

name: lateral deviation of upper ureter
description: Outward displacement of the ureter's upper portion

name: lesion of perinephric space
description: Abnormality or mass in the space surrounding the kidney

name: localized bulge of renal outline
description: Protrusion affecting a specific area of the kidney's shape

name: lower abdominal calcification
description: A calcified mass or focus in the lower abdominal region, possibly representing stones, calcified lymph nodes, or vascular calcifications.

name: macroorchidism
description: Enlargement of the testes, often seen in genetic disorders.

name: male megalourethra
description: Congenital abnormality characterized by an abnormally dilated urethra.

name: malposition of kidney
description: One or both kidneys located outside their typical anatomical position.

name: mass displacing kidney
description: A lesion or growth that causes displacement of kidney tissue.

name: mass in scrotum
description: An abnormal growth or lesion within the scrotal sac.

name: medial deviation of upper ureter
description: Abnormal positioning of the upper ureter towards the midline of the body.

name: medullary nephrocalcinosis
description: Calcium deposition in the renal medulla, often associated with certain metabolic disorders.

name: microorchidism
description: Abnormally small testes, may result from a variety of developmental disorders.

name: micropenis
description: A condition where the penis is significantly smaller than typical for age and ethnic background.

name: multilocular or complex renal mass
description: A renal mass with multiple compartments or complex structure, potentially suspicious for malignancy.

name: multiloculated cystic renal lesion
description: A cystic lesion in the kidney with multiple loculi or small chambers.

name: multiple ureteral filling defects
description: Presence of multiple interruptions or defects in a contrast-filled ureter, possibly indicating stones or lesions.

name: mural ureteral filling defect
description: A localized defect along the wall of the ureter seen in contrast studies, potentially a tumor or pathologic lesion.

name: neonatal renal mass
description: A mass located in the kidney of a newborn, potentially indicating a congenital anomaly or tumor.

name: nephroblastomatosis
description: Presence of nephrogenic rests, predisposing to Wilms' tumor in children.

name: nephrocalcinosis
description: Diffuse calcium deposits in the renal parenchyma, associated with various metabolic disorders.

name: nephrogenic rests
description: Embryonic renal cells remaining in the kidney after birth, can develop into Wilms' tumor.

name: nephropathy
description: General term for kidney damage or disease, may have various etiologies.

name: non-germ cell testicular tumor
description: A testicular tumor that is not derived from germ cells; can include stromal tumors.

name: nonfunction of part of kidney
description: A section of the kidney is not functioning properly, possibly due to obstruction or damage.

name: obstruction of ureter
description: Blockage in the ureter, leading to urinary outflow obstruction.

name: ovarian cyst
description: A fluid-filled sac within or on the surface of an ovary.

name: ovarian mass in pregnancy
description: An abnormal growth located on or in an ovary detected during pregnancy.

name: ovarian neoplasm or cyst in a child
description: A new and abnormal growth of ovarian tissue or a fluid-filled sac in a child.

name: ovarian tumor
description: Abnormal growth originating from the ovarian tissue.

name: pelvic mass in an infant or child
description: Any abnormal growth in the pelvic region of a child or infant.

name: perinephric hematoma
description: A collection of blood in the space surrounding the kidney usually due to trauma or surgery.

name: peripelvic extravasation
description: Leakage of urine from the renal pelvis into surrounding tissues.

name: peripheral rim enhancement of kidney
description: Outer enhancement around the kidney on contrast imaging, possibly indicating infection or infarction.

name: perirenal fluid collection
description: Accumulation of fluid around the kidney, could indicate hemorrhage or infection.

name: pheochromocytoma
description: A rare tumor of adrenal gland tissue that leads to excessive hormone production.

name: polyhydramnios
description: Excessive amniotic fluid volume during pregnancy.

name: precocious puberty
description: Unusually early onset of puberty.

name: prominence of central uterine echo
description: Increased central uterus echo may suggest endometrial abnormality.

name: pseudohermaphroditism
description: Condition where an individual has secondary sex characteristics differing from primary sex organs.

name: radiodense urinary calculus
description: A radiopaque kidney stone detectable on radiography.

name: radiolucent urinary calculus
description: A kidney stone that does not appear on standard radiography but may be seen on ultrasound or CT.

name: renal artery aneurysm or microaneurysm
description: An abnormal bulge or ballooning in a renal artery.

name: renal collecting system echoes
description: Acoustic echoes seen within the renal pelvis or calyces on ultrasound.

name: renal cystic disease
description: A group of kidney disorders characterized by the presence of multiple cysts.

name: renal hemorrhage
description: Bleeding within the kidney parenchyma or surrounding area.

name: renal ischemia
description: Decreased blood flow to the kidney causing functional impairment.

name: renal mass in a child
description: Abnormal tissue growth in the kidney of a pediatric patient.

name: renal mass with calcification
description: A kidney mass characterized by areas of calcification within it.

name: renal papillary necrosis
description: Necrosis of the renal papillae, often associated with infection or ischemia.

name: renal parenchymal gas
description: Presence of gas within the renal parenchyma usually indicating infection.

name: renal parenchymal tumor
description: An abnormal growth originating from the kidney tissue.

name: renal pseudotumor
description: Normal anatomical structures in the kidney that mimic a mass but are not genuine tumors.

name: renal vein thrombosis
description: Blood clot formation in the renal vein.

name: right anterior pararenal space abscess
description: A localized collection of pus in the anterior pararenal space to the right of the midline.

name: scrotal calcification
description: Calcified deposits within or on the scrotum.

name: seminal vesicle calcification
description: Calcified areas in the seminal vesicles.

name: shadowing mass in renal collecting system
description: An echogenic mass within the renal collecting system causing acoustic shadowing.

name: small bladder
description: Reduced urinary bladder volume, possibly indicative of various pathologies.

name: small kidney
description: Reduced size of the kidney, potentially indicating chronic disease.

name: small urinary bladder
description: A urinary bladder of reduced size that may impact urine storage.

name: solid extratesticular mass in scrotum
description: A solid mass located outside of the testicle within the scrotal sac.

name: solid ovarian tumor
description: A mass of solid tissue arising within the ovary.

name: solid pelvic mass
description: An abnormal mass located within the pelvis that is solid in composition.

name: solid renal mass
description: Discrete solid mass in the kidney, could be benign or malignant.

name: solid testicular mass
description: Solid mass within the testicle, potentially malignant.

name: sonographically ill-defined renal parenchymal mass
description: Poorly defined mass in the kidney parenchyma on ultrasound.

name: striated nephrogram
description: Alternating bands of high and low nephrogram densities.

name: T1-hyperintense adnexal mass
description: Adnexal mass that appears hyperintense on T1-weighted MRI.

name: T1-hyperintense adrenal mass
description: Adrenal mass with high signal on T1-weighted MRI.

name: T1-hyperintense endometrial uterine mass
description: Endometrial mass with high signal on T1-weighted MRI.

name: T1-hyperintense myometrial uterine mass
description: Myometrial mass with high signal on T1-weighted MRI.

name: T1-hyperintense prostate mass
description: Prostate mass showing high signal on T1-weighted MRI.

name: T1-hyperintense renal mass
description: Renal mass with high T1 signal on MRI.

name: T2-dark seminal vesicle
description: Seminal vesicle appearing dark on T2-weighted MRI.

name: T2-hyperintense adnexal mass
description: Adnexal mass appearing hyperintense on T2-weighted MRI.

name: T2-hyperintense adrenal mass
description: Adrenal mass appearing hyperintense on T2-weighted MRI.

name: T2-hyperintense endometrial uterine mass
description: Endometrial mass that appears hyperintense on T2-weighted MRI.

name: T2-hyperintense myometrial uterine mass
description: Myometrial mass with high signal on T2-weighted MRI.

name: T2-hyperintense prostate mass
description: Prostate mass appearing hyperintense on T2-weighted MRI.

name: T2-hyperintense renal mass
description: Renal mass with high T2 signal on MRI.

name: T2-hypointense adnexal mass
description: Adnexal mass that appears hypointense on T2-weighted MRI.

name: T2-hypointense endometrial uterine mass
description: Endometrial mass appearing dark on T2-weighted MRI.

name: T2-hypointense myometrial uterine mass
description: Myometrial mass appearing dark on T2-weighted MRI.

name: T2-hypointense peripheral zone of prostate
description: Reduced signal intensity on T2-weighted MRI in the peripheral zone of prostate

name: T2-hypointense prostate mass
description: Mass within the prostate exhibiting low signal intensity on T2-weighted MRI

name: T2-hypointense renal mass
description: Renal mass exhibiting low signal intensity on T2-weighted MRI

name: T2-intermediate adrenal mass
description: Adrenal mass with signal intensity similar to surrounding tissues on T2-weighted MRI

name: T2-intermediate endometrial uterine mass
description: Endometrial mass with intermediate signal intensity on T2-weighted MRI

name: T2-intermediate myometrial uterine mass
description: Myometrial mass with intermediate signal intensity on T2-weighted MRI

name: T2-intermediate renal mass
description: Renal mass with intermediate signal intensity on T2-weighted MRI

name: testicular anomaly
description: Abnormal development or structure of the testicle

name: testicular calcification
description: Calcific deposits within the testicle

name: testicular tumor in a child
description: Neoplastic growth within the testicle of a child

name: unilateral absence or blurring of renal outline
description: One kidney has a poorly defined or absent border

name: unilateral adrenal enlargement
description: Enlargement of one adrenal gland

name: unilateral large kidney
description: One kidney is larger than normal or its counterpart

name: unilateral renal nonfunction
description: One kidney does not function normally or at all

name: unilateral small kidney
description: One kidney is smaller than normal or its counterpart

name: unilateral testicular tumor
description: Tumor present in one testicle

name: unilaterally decreased renal contrast concentration
description: Lower concentration of contrast in one kidney

name: ureteral and renal pelvic calcification
description: Calcific deposits within the ureter and renal pelvis

name: ureteral extravasation or fistula
description: Abnormal leakage of urine or an abnormal connection involving the ureter

name: ureteral stricture
description: Narrowing of the ureter, restricting urine flow

name: ureteral tumor
description: A growth or mass located within the ureter.

name: urethral filling defect
description: An interruption or defect in contrast filling of the urethra.

name: urethral fistula
description: An abnormal connection between the urethra and another structure.

name: urethral outpouching
description: A pouch or saccular protrusion in the urethra.

name: urethral tumor
description: A mass or neoplasm affecting the urethra.

name: urinary tract calculus
description: A stone found within the urinary tract.

name: urinary tract obstruction below the bladder in a child
description: Blockage of urine flow occurring below the bladder in pediatric patients.

name: urothelial tumor
description: A neoplasm originating from the urothelium lining the urinary tract.

name: uterine anomaly
description: A congenital or acquired structural abnormality of the uterus.

name: vaginal anomaly
description: Abnormal structural formation within the vagina.

name: vaginal atresia
description: Complete or partial absence or closure of the vaginal canal.

name: vaginal fistula
description: An abnormal connection between the vagina and another organ.

name: vas deferens calcification
description: Calcium deposits found within the vas deferens.

name: vascular indentation on ureter or renal pelvis
description: An impression made by a vessel onto the ureter or renal pelvis.
